item.title: Report E-2024110210
item.description:
Report E-2024110210

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: BENSALEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNA experienced a UN1760 Biotrend Eco-Clear release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 ounces of product released to a 6” x 6” area of the dock and poly containment pallet. The release was due to improper loading; however, the damage was not visible. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. Vinegar was then used along with absorbents to clean the impacted pallet and dock. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with absorbents and pads into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH WITH FROST FORMING ON THE OUTER BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FOUR POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024110212
item.description:
Report E-2024110212

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 5, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed absorbent pads to the paint-impacted trailer. All spent absorbent pads, impacted wrap, PPE, and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was collected and containerized into one (1) overpack drum.

  • Description: PLASTIC 5 GALLON BUCKET WITH A CORROSIVE DIAMOND LABEL AND MULTI-PART FORM HAZMAT PAPERS WAS FOUND LEAKING NEAR THE IREG-6 BELT ON THE FLOOR. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND TRANSPORTED BUCKET TO THE DMP AREA WHILE WEARING GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, NITRILE GLOVES WITH SILVER SHIELD INSIDE. PROCESSED THE CORROSIVE LIQUID USING SODIUM BICARBONATE AND ZEP ZORBENT.

  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY THE PICKOFF ON THE PD 11. THE PICKOFF STOPPED THE BELT, LOCKED IT, TESTED IT, LEFT THE AREA, AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE LID ON THE INNER 5 GALLON PLASIC CONTAINER HAD A SMALL PERFORATION IN THE CENTER THAT HAD ALLOWED 4 OUNCES OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OUTER CONTAINER.

  • Description: On October 29, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were torn in transit and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews down stacked the pallet and collected three (3) 50-pound damaged bags. GES then utilized hand tools to collect the spent product off of the trailer floor. All spent product and damaged bags were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 8ft-by-50ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to a defective metal drum. EnviroServe personnel used hand tools and absorbent rags to removed the solidified material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and the defective drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the J.B. Hunt terminal pending profile approval.

Clean Harbors personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used a granular absorbent to recover the spent material. The spent absorbents were containerized into six (6) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste were transported to a nearby ESTES terminal. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110171
item.description:
Report E-2024110171

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: BOSTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 16, 2024, at Eli Lilly's Boston facility, Veolia employees were in the process of loading drums onto a truck when they detected a solvent odor. Initially, they attributed the smell to recently filled drums. However, upon relocating the vehicle, they discovered a pinhole leak in the top of one drum, just below the upper chime. The affected container was a 55-gallon plastic drum, and it is believed that the puncture occurred during its removal from the storage location. Upon discovering the leak, employees promptly reported the incident and transferred the leaking drum into an 851A2 salvage drum to ensure safe transportation to the final disposal facility. Approximately one pint of halogenated solvent waste escaped from the drum. The spill was quickly contained using spill pads and absorbent materials. The leaking drum, along with the cleanup materials, was then placed into an appropriate salvage drum. Given the small size of the hole and the rapid response of the team, the release is estimated to have lasted about 10 minutes. The drum was still largely full when the leak was detected, and the quantity released did not exceed the reportable quantity (RQ) threshold.

item.description:
Report E-2024110193

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: WAITE PARK
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XBD experienced a UN3352 Lambda-Cyhalothrin 1 EC release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor. The box was damaged due to improper loading, appearing to have been hit by another pallet or forklift. A total of (8) 1-gallon poly jugs of product were found impacted and placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents, cardboard, PPE, and cleanup debris were placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On November 1, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN3149 were punctured in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged containers of product were placed into two (2) 5-gallon containers and staged on the trailer to be taken back to the terminal as product.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 04:23 EST XPO-XHG contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 15 gallons of Acetone ACS Grade from a 55-gallon metal drum, impacting the dock and trailer floor due to forklift puncture. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12 gallons of Acetone ACS Grade product released from (1) 55-gallon metal drum to a 10’x4’ area impacting concrete dock floor and concrete beneath trailer due to being tote being punctured by forklift. The product and 55-gallon metal drum were overpacked into (1) 85-gallon metal drum, acetone impacted granular absorbents and pallet pieces were containerized to (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to pick up.

  • Description: At 21:59 ET on 10/11, XPO-XCF contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 ounce of "FT-100 Concentrate" from a 275-gallon poly tote impacting only the top face of the container. The tote has a loose cap as a packaging error by the shipper. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 ounces of FT-100 Concentrate product released from the cap of the 275-gallon poly tote due to being loose - improper packaging. The contractors tightened the cap and containerized the impacted absorbent pads and PPE into (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 8:32 AM ET, XCD contacted the call center to request help with a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Cadillac, MI. The spill consists of approximately 100 gallons of AB-100, which was released from 1 275-gallon plastic tote due to a forklift puncture. Contractors neutralized 110' area with KolorSafe, cut up tote and cleaned impacted pallets were swapped for new ones. Impacted and neutralized absorbents were placed into (8) 55-gallon metal drums, cut up tote pieces were containerized in (2) 55-gallon metal drums, cubic yard box was used to contain neutralized and impacted pallet pieces. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024110138
item.description:
Report E-2024110138

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UTU experienced a UN1805 System Yellow release from a 30-gallon poly drum due to a broken pallet and nail puncturing the drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. XPO terminal personnel overpacked the damaged drum into a 30-gallon poly drum and deployed absorbents prior to contractors’ arrival. When the crew arrived onsite, they confirmed approximately 8-gallons or product released to a 10’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor, 15’ x 15’ area of the concrete dock floor, and a 4’ x 4’ area of the concrete lot below the trailer floor. Absorbents and sodium bicarb were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On November 5, 2024, three (3) 7-gallon kegs of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the wooden pallet underneath the kegs. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel collected the three (3) damaged 7-gallon kegs of product and containerized them in one (1) 55-gallon drum, deploying absorbents inside to mitigate further release. The crew utilized absorbent pads to remediate the UN1263 paint-impacted wooden pallet. All impacted absorbents were containerized in the same one (1) 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

The crew overpacked the damaged bottles in two (2) 55-gallon drums. The crew contained all released materials and impacted debris in one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal.

The driver started the air and soon after it started to leak product from the top dome. The driver immediately shut it down and notified the customer and his supervisor. The customer blocked off the nearest sewer drain with boom and absorbent. A third party cleanup contractor was sent in to neutralize and remove the product that was released. The cause of the release was determined to be over filled product.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BCO experienced a UN3295 Odorless Mineral Spirits release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct onsite cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to a crack in the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents and placed into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024110103
item.description:
Report X-2024110103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-04
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/4/2024 at approximately 1015, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 240946 at the station location in Spokane, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 4 plastic bottles, packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered emitting an odor during sort. Further investigation revealed a stain along the bottom of the box. Upon examining the inner contents, one of the bottles appeared damp around the closure. A safety data sheet found inside of the packaging classified the commodity as UN3082. It appears the shipment was tendered under IATA Special Provisions A197; however, the packaging of the shipment did not comply with IATA 5.0.2.6.1.3 and 5.0.2.8., not having sufficient closure, ullage, or absorbent material. The shipment is being held for an FAA investigation.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the site. ES+ personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3267-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. E3 personnel transferred the product from the 275-gallon tote to a 330-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. The damaged tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for future disposal by CES personnel.

item.title: Report E-2024100528
item.description:
Report E-2024100528

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: Nashville
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/9/24, at 04:37 personnel in the CSXT Radnor discovered SHPX221329, a residue tank car of Butadiene, leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, BASF, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-1009-00030). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the B-end liquid valve partially open and the Drylok-style secondary securement not containing the release. Contractor personnel closed the valve and stopped the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative (Scott McDonald, 409 981-5133). The car was subsequently held at Radnor Yard until the secondary closure was replaced and an OTMA-1 was submitted and approved by the FRA.

item.description:

  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight Lines personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of Sodium Bromide released from one (1) plastic bucket due to improper handling. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned up the spill using Oil Dri absorbent. Personnel completed cleanup and generated one (1) four (4) gallon plastic drum of waste containing the spilled product and spent absorbents. Dayton Freight also generated one (1) ten (10) gallon plastic drum of waste containing the punctured bucket. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
